Electrify.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electrify turns into Z-Electrify and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Electrify.detailed_effect: Electrify causes the target's move to become Electric type, if it has yet to attack during that turn.

Electro Ball.effect: The faster the user, the stronger the attack.
Electro Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electro Ball turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.
Electro Ball.detailed_effect:
Electro Ball inflicts more damage the faster the user is compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = User Speed ÷ Target Speed

For example, if the user's Speed is at least 3 times more than the target but less than 4 times, Electro Ball hits with 120 base power.

Electro Drift.effect: Boosted even more if it's super-effective.
Electro Drift.detailed_effect: Boosted even more if it's super-effective.

Electro Shot.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second.
Electro Shot.detailed_effect:
The user absorbs electricity on the first turn and raises its Special Attack; on the second turn, Electro Shot deals damage.

During rain , Electro Shot executes in one turn.

Electroweb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electroweb turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.
Electroweb.detailed_effect:
Electroweb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Embargo.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Embargo turns into Z-Embargo and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Embargo.detailed_effect: Embargo prevents the target using any items for five turns. This includes both held items and items used by the trainer such as medicines.

Ember.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ember turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.
Ember.detailed_effect:
Ember deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Encore.effect: Forces opponent to keep using its last move for 3 turns.
Encore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Encore turns into Z-Encore and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Encore.detailed_effect:
Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns.

Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic , Mirror Move , Sketch , Struggle or Transform .

Endeavor.effect: Reduces opponent's HP to same as user's.
Endeavor.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endeavor turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Endeavor.detailed_effect: Endeavor reduces the opponent's HP to equal the user's. (It fails if the user's HP is higher than the target's.)

Endure.effect: Always left with at least 1 HP, but may fail if used consecutively.
Endure.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endure turns into Z-Endure and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Endure.detailed_effect:
Endure allows the user to survive all attacks during the turn with at least 1 HP (even if it already has 1 HP remaining). It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Endure decreases by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Detect , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , King's Shield , or Baneful Bunker .

Energy Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Energy Ball turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.
Energy Ball.detailed_effect:
Energy Ball deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Entrainment.effect: Makes target's ability same as user's.
Entrainment.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Entrainment turns into Z-Entrainment and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Entrainment.detailed_effect:
Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's.

It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant , Multitype or Zen Mode .

Eruption.effect: Stronger when the user's HP is higher.
Eruption.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eruption turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.
Eruption.detailed_effect:
Eruption inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i. e. the power is:

Eruption is a counterpart move to Water Spout . It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out , based on the user rather than the opponent.

Esper Wing.effect: High critical hit ratio. Raises user's Speed.
Esper Wing.detailed_effect:
Esper Wing deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Eternabeam.effect: User can't move on the next turn.
Eternabeam.detailed_effect: User can't move on the next turn.

Expanding Force.effect: Increases power and hits all opponents on Psychic Terrain.
Expanding Force.detailed_effect:
The user attacks the target with its psychic power. This move’s power goes up and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain.

Expanding Force is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Explosion.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Explosion turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Explosion.detailed_effect: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.

Extrasensory.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extrasensory turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Extrasensory.detailed_effect:
Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Extreme Evoboost.effect: Eevee-exclusive Z-Move. Sharply raises all stats.
Extreme Evoboost.detailed_effect:
Extreme Evoboost is a Z-Move exclusive to Eevee . It is used with Last Resort .

Extreme Evoboost raises all the user's stats (Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, Speed) by two stages each.

Extreme Speed.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extreme Speed turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Extreme Speed.detailed_effect: Extreme Speed deals damage and attacks before the majority of other moves (priority of +2).

Facade.effect: Power doubles if user is burned, poisoned, or paralyzed.
Facade.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Facade turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Facade.detailed_effect:
Facade deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the user is burned, poisoned or paralyzed.

In the case of a burn, the usual attack-halving still occurs so Facade hits with an effective power of 70.

Fairy Lock.effect: Prevents fleeing in the next turn.
Fairy Lock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Lock turns into Z-Fairy Lock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Fairy Lock.detailed_effect: Fairy Lock prevents all Pokémon on the field from fleeing during the following turn.

Fairy Wind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Wind turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.
Fairy Wind.detailed_effect: Fairy Wind deals damage with no added effects.

Fake Out.effect: User attacks first, foe flinches. Only usable on first turn.
Fake Out.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Fake Out.detailed_effect:
Fake Out attacks with a priority of +3 and causes the target to flinch if it hits. It is only successful on the first turn the Pokémon is in battle, but reset each time the Pokémon switches out and back in.

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Fake Tears.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Tears turns into Z-Fake Tears and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Fake Tears.detailed_effect:
Fake Tears lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

False Swipe.effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
False Swipe.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, False Swipe turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
False Swipe.detailed_effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.

Feather Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feather Dance turns into Z-Feather Dance and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Feather Dance.detailed_effect:
Feather Dance lowers the target's Attack by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Feint.effect: Only hits if opponent uses Protect or Detect in the same turn.
Feint.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Feint.detailed_effect: Feint only hits if the target used Protect or Detect in the same turn. It also cancels Protect/Detect for the remainder of the turn, so subsequent moves in the same turn (in double/triple battles) can still hit.

Feint Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint Attack turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.
Feint Attack.detailed_effect: Feint Attack deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Fell Stinger.effect: Drastically raises user's Attack if target is KO'd.
Fell Stinger.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fell Stinger turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.
Fell Stinger.detailed_effect:
Fell Stinger deals damage, and if the target is knocked out by this move, the user's Attack is raised by three stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Fickle Beam.detailed_effect: Fickle Beam deals damage with 80 base power, however there is a 30% chance for the power to double to 160.

Fiery Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fiery Dance turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Fiery Dance.detailed_effect:
Fiery Dance deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Fillet Away.effect: Lowers HP but sharply boosts Attack, Special Attack, and Speed.
Fillet Away.detailed_effect: Lowers HP but sharply boosts Attack, Special Attack, and Speed.

Final Gambit.effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.
Final Gambit.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Final Gambit turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.
Final Gambit.detailed_effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.

Fire Blast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Blast turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 185.
Fire Blast.detailed_effect:
Fire Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Fire Fang.effect: May cause flinching and/or burn opponent.
Fire Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Fang turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.
Fire Fang.detailed_effect:
Fire Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of burning the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Fire Lash.effect: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat.
Fire Lash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Lash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Fire Lash.detailed_effect: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat. (100% chance)

Fire Pledge.effect: Added effects appear if combined with Grass Pledge or Water Pledge.
Fire Pledge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Pledge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Fire Pledge.detailed_effect:
Fire Pledge deals damage at base power 80 . If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.

The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move . When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.

If Fire Pledge is used with Grass Pledge , the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns.

If Fire Pledge is used with Water Pledge , the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.

Fire Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Punch turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.
Fire Punch.detailed_effect:
Fire Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Fire Spin.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Fire Spin.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Spin turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.
Fire Spin.detailed_effect:
Fire Spin inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

First Impression.effect: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
First Impression.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, First Impression turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.
First Impression.detailed_effect: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.

Fishious Rend.effect: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
Fishious Rend.detailed_effect: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.

Fissure.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fissure turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.
Fissure.detailed_effect:
If it hits, Fissure is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.

Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Fissure has 30% accuracy.

Flail.effect: The lower the user's HP, the higher the power.
Flail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flail turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Flail.detailed_effect:
Flail deals more damage the lower the user's HP. The following formula is used:

The value of N is then used to determine the base power, as per the table below. It converts to some quite specific percentages which are also shown.

Flame Burst.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Burst turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.
Flame Burst.detailed_effect:
Flame Burst deals damage and will also cause splash damage to any Pokémon adjacent to the target (including the user if Flame Burst is targeted at an ally).

The splash damage caused to a Pokémon is 1/16 of its maximum HP. It is typeless and not counted as regular damage but treated similarly to weather damage, which means that:

Flame Charge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Charge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.
Flame Charge.detailed_effect:
Flame Charge deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Flame Wheel.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Wheel turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.
Flame Wheel.detailed_effect:
Flame Wheel deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

If the user is frozen, Flame Wheel can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

Flamethrower.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flamethrower turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175.
Flamethrower.detailed_effect:
Flamethrower deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Flare Blitz.effect: User receives recoil damage. May burn opponent.
Flare Blitz.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flare Blitz turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 190.
Flare Blitz.detailed_effect:
Flare Blitz deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

If the user is frozen, Flare Blitz can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

Flash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash turns into Z-Flash and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Flash.detailed_effect:
Flash lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Flash Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash Cannon turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.
Flash Cannon.detailed_effect:
Flash Cannon deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Flatter.effect: Confuses opponent, but raises its Special Attack.
Flatter.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flatter turns into Z-Flatter and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Flatter.detailed_effect:
Flatter confuses the target, and raises its Special Attack by one stage.

If one of the two effects cannot be invoked (for example the target is already confused or its Special Attack already raised to the maximum of +6 stages), Flatter still works and will invoke the other effect.

Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

Fleur Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fleur Cannon turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 195.
Fleur Cannon.detailed_effect:
Fleur Cannon deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Fling.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fling turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

Flip Turn.effect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
Flip Turn.detailed_effect:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

Flip Turn is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Floaty Fall.detailed_effect:
Floaty Fall deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Floaty Fall is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Zippy Zap and Splishy Splash .

Floral Healing.effect: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.
Floral Healing.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Floral Healing turns into Z-Floral Healing and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Floral Healing.detailed_effect: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.

Flower Shield.effect: Sharply raises Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon on the field.
Flower Shield.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flower Shield turns into Z-Flower Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Flower Shield.detailed_effect:
Flower Shield raises the Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle (including opponents) by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Flower Trick.effect: Never misses; always results in a critical hit.
Flower Trick.detailed_effect: Never misses; always results in a critical hit.

Fly.effect: Flies up on first turn, attacks on second turn.
Fly.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Fly.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fly turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 175.
Fly.detailed_effect:
The user of Fly will fly up high on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Fly deals damage.

While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust , Twister , Thunder , Sky Uppercut and Smack Down , with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power.

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Fly executes in one turn.

Flying Press.effect: Deals Fighting and Flying type damage.
Flying Press.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flying Press turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 170.
Flying Press.detailed_effect:
Flying Press deals damage. It is a Fighting type move, but deals a combination of Fighting and Flying type damage. This in effect gives the move its own type chart, as shown below.

Although Flying Press deals dual type damage, it is still a pure Fighting type move so only gains STAB from Fighting type Pokémon.

If the target has used Minimize , Flying Press ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Focus Blast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Blast turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.
Focus Blast.detailed_effect:
Focus Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Focus Energy.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Energy turns into Z-Focus Energy and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Focus Punch.effect: If the user is hit before attacking, it flinches instead.
Focus Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 200.
Focus Punch.detailed_effect:
The user of Focus Punch will tighten its focus before any other moves are made. If any regular move (with a higher priority than -3) directly hits the focused Pokémon, it loses its focus and flinches, not carrying out the attack. If no direct hits are made, Focus Punch attacks as normal.

Moves of lower priority than Focus Punch - for example Avalanche or Dragon Tail - will not cause the user to lose focus. The user will tighten their focus, Focus Punch will attack, then the opponent will use their lower priority move (and in the case of Avalanche , hit with double power).

Follow Me.effect: In Double Battle, the user takes all the attacks.
Follow Me.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Follow Me turns into Z-Follow Me and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Follow Me.detailed_effect: In Double Battle, the user takes all the attacks.

Force Palm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Force Palm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Force Palm.detailed_effect:
Force Palm deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Foresight.effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.
Foresight.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foresight turns into Z-Foresight and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Foresight.detailed_effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.

Forest's Curse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Forest's Curse turns into Z-Forest's Curse and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Forest's Curse.detailed_effect:
Forest's Curse adds the Grass type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon.

It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Grass. If the target is under the effect of Trick-or-Treat the Ghost type is replaced by Grass.

Foul Play.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foul Play turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 175.
Foul Play.detailed_effect: Foul Play uses the opponent's Attack stat instead of the user's in damage calculation. In other words, the move acts as if the target is attacking themselves, and thus is more powerful when the opponent has higher Attack.

Freeze Shock.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second. May paralyze opponent.
Freeze Shock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze Shock turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.
Freeze Shock.detailed_effect:
The user of Freeze Shock will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb , Freeze Shock executes in one turn.

Freeze-Dry.effect: May freeze opponent. Super-effective against Water types.
Freeze-Dry.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze-Dry turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.
Freeze-Dry.detailed_effect: Freeze-Dry deals damage and has a 10% change of freezing the target. In addition to Ice's usual type advantages, Freeze-Dry is also super-effective against the Water type. This in effect gives the move its own (slightly different) type chart, as shown below:

Freezy Frost.detailed_effect:
Freezy Frost deals damage and eliminates stat changes from all Pokémon on the field (similar to Haze ).

Freezy Frost is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Sizzly Slide , Glitzy Glow , Baddy Bad , Sappy Seed , and Sparkly Swirl .

Frenzy Plant.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frenzy Plant turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 200.

Frost Breath.effect: Always results in a critical hit.
Frost Breath.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frost Breath turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Frost Breath.detailed_effect:
Frost Breath deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90 .

Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Frost Breath will hit them with base power 60.

Frustration.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frustration turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Frustration.detailed_effect:
The power of Frustration is higher when the Pokémon likes its trainer less. The base power varies between 1 (maximum Friendship) and 102 (minimum Friendship). The exact formula is:

Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 ( more details ).

Frustration is the counterpart move to Return .

Fury Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Fury Attack.detailed_effect:
Fury Attack hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Fury Attack is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Fury Attack to always hit the maximum number of times.

Fury Cutter.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Cutter turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.
Fury Cutter.detailed_effect:
Fury Cutter deals damage starting at base power 40, and for each successful consecutive hit doubles in power, up to a maximum base power of 160.

If the move misses for any reason, the base power resets to 40.

Fury Swipes.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Swipes turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Fury Swipes.detailed_effect:
Fury Swipes hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Fury Swipes is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Fury Swipes to always hit the maximum number of times.

Fusion Bolt.effect: Power increases if Fusion Flare is used in the same turn.
Fusion Bolt.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Bolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180.
Fusion Bolt.detailed_effect: Fusion Bolt deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Flare has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Bolt's animation will change to look more epic.

Fusion Flare.effect: Power increases if Fusion Bolt is used in the same turn.
Fusion Flare.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Flare turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.
Fusion Flare.detailed_effect:
Fusion Flare deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Bolt has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Flare's animation will change to look more epic.

If the user is frozen, Fusion Flare can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

Future Sight.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Future Sight turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.
Future Sight.detailed_effect:
Future Sight deals damage, but does not hit until two turns after the move is used. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the new Pokémon gets hit, with their type and stats taken into account.

Future Sight cannot be stopped by Protect , Detect , Endure or the Wonder Guard ability.

G-Max Befuddle.effect: Butterfree-exclusive G-Max Move. Poisons, paralyzes, or puts opponent to sleep.
G-Max Befuddle.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Befuddle.detailed_effect:
G-Max Befuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Butterfree . Bug type moves turn into G-Max Befuddle during Gigantamax.

G-Max Befuddle deals damage and causes poison, paralysis or sleep to each opponent.

G-Max Cannonade.effect: Blastoise-exclusive G-Max Move. Damages non-Water types for 4 turns.
G-Max Cannonade.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Cannonade.detailed_effect:
G-Max Cannonade is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Blastoise . Water type moves turn into G-Max Cannonade during Gigantamax.

G-Max Cannonade deals damage and causes all non-Water type opponents to lose 1/6 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4 turns.

G-Max Centiferno.effect: Centiskorch-exclusive G-Max Move. Traps opponents for 4-5 turns.
G-Max Centiferno.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Centiferno.detailed_effect:
G-Max Centiferno is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Centiskorch . Fire type moves turn into G-Max Centiferno during Gigantamax.

G-Max Centiferno deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Fire Spin .

G-Max Chi Strike.effect: Machamp-exclusive G-Max Move. Increases critical hit ratio.
G-Max Chi Strike.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Chi Strike.detailed_effect:
G-Max Chi Strike is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Machamp . Fighting type moves turn into G-Max Chi Strike during Gigantamax.

G-Max Chi Strike deals damage and increases the user's critical hit ratio.

G-Max Cuddle.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Cuddle.detailed_effect:
G-Max Cuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Eevee . Normal type moves turn into G-Max Cuddle during Gigantamax.

G-Max Cuddle deals damage and infatuates all opposite-gender opponents.

G-Max Depletion.effect: Duraludon-exclusive G-Max Move. Reduces opponent's PP.
G-Max Depletion.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Depletion.detailed_effect:
G-Max Depletion is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Duraludon . Dragon type moves turn into G-Max Depletion during Gigantamax.

G-Max Depletion deals damage and reduces the PP of the last move used.

G-Max Drum Solo.effect: Rillaboom-exclusive G-Max Move. Ignores target's ability.
G-Max Drum Solo.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Drum Solo.detailed_effect:
G-Max Drum Solo is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Rillaboom . Grass type moves turn into G-Max Drum Solo during Gigantamax.

G-Max Drum Solo deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160 , regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves.

G-Max Finale.effect: Alcremie-exclusive G-Max Move. Heals the user's team.
G-Max Finale.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Finale.detailed_effect:
G-Max Finale is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Alcremie . Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Finale during Gigantamax.

G-Max Finale deals damage and heals Pokémon on the user's side of the field.

G-Max Fireball.effect: Cinderace-exclusive G-Max Move. Ignores target's ability.
G-Max Fireball.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Fireball.detailed_effect:
G-Max Fireball is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Cinderace . Fire type moves turn into G-Max Fireball during Gigantamax.

G-Max Fireball deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160 , regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves.

G-Max Foam Burst.effect: Kingler-exclusive G-Max Move. Harshly lowers opponents' Speed.
G-Max Foam Burst.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Foam Burst.detailed_effect:
G-Max Foam Burst is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Kingler . Water type moves turn into G-Max Foam Burst during Gigantamax.

G-Max Foam Burst deals damage and lowers the Speed of all opponents by two stages.

G-Max Gold Rush.effect: Meowth-exclusive G-Max Move. Confuses opponents and earns more money.
G-Max Gold Rush.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Gold Rush.detailed_effect:
G-Max Gold Rush is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Kantonian Meowth . Normal type moves turn into G-Max Gold Rush during Gigantamax.

G-Max Gold Rush deals damage and confuses all opponents. It also earns extra money after the battle.

G-Max Gravitas.effect: Orbeetle-exclusive G-Max Move. Summons Gravity for 5 turns.
G-Max Gravitas.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Gravitas.detailed_effect:
G-Max Gravitas is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Orbeetle . Psychic type moves turn into G-Max Gravitas during Gigantamax.

G-Max Gravitas deals damage and summons intense gravity for 5 turns, like the move Gravity .

G-Max Hydrosnipe.effect: Inteleon-exclusive G-Max Move. Ignores target's ability.
G-Max Hydrosnipe.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Hydrosnipe.detailed_effect:
G-Max Hydrosnipe is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Inteleon . Water type moves turn into G-Max Hydrosnipe during Gigantamax.

G-Max Hydrosnipe deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160 , regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves.

G-Max Malodor.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Malodor.detailed_effect:
G-Max Malodor is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Garbodor . Poison type moves turn into G-Max Malodor during Gigantamax.

G-Max Malodor deals damage and poisons opponents.

G-Max Meltdown.effect: Melmetal-exclusive G-Max Move. Prevents opponents using the same move twice in a row.
G-Max Meltdown.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Meltdown.detailed_effect:
G-Max Meltdown is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Melmetal . Steel type moves turn into G-Max Meltdown during Gigantamax.

G-Max Meltdown deals damage and prevents opponents using the same move twice in a row, like Torment .

G-Max One Blow.effect: Urshifu Single-Strike Style-exclusive G-Max Move. Strikes through Max Guard and Protect.
G-Max One Blow.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max One Blow.detailed_effect:
G-Max One Blow is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Urshifu (Single Strike Style) . Dark type moves turn into G-Max One Blow during Gigantamax.

G-Max One Blow deals damage and can hit through Max Guard and any Protect-like move.

G-Max Rapid Flow.effect: Urshifu Rapid-Strike Style-exclusive G-Max Move. Strikes through Max Guard and Protect.
G-Max Rapid Flow.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Rapid Flow.detailed_effect:
G-Max Rapid Flow is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Urshifu (Rapid Strike Style) . Water type moves turn into G-Max Rapid Flow during Gigantamax.

G-Max Rapid Flow deals damage and can hit through Max Guard and any Protect-like move.

G-Max Replenish.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Replenish.detailed_effect:
G-Max Replenish is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Snorlax . Normal type moves turn into G-Max Replenish during Gigantamax.

G-Max Replenish deals damage and restores berries that have been eaten, so they can be used again.

G-Max Resonance.effect: Lapras-exclusive G-Max Move. Reduces damage for 5 turns.
G-Max Resonance.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Resonance.detailed_effect:
G-Max Resonance is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Lapras . Ice type moves turn into G-Max Resonance during Gigantamax.

G-Max Resonance deals damage and reduces the damage received for 5 turns.

G-Max Sandblast.effect: Sandaconda-exclusive G-Max Move. Traps opponents for 4-5 turns.
G-Max Sandblast.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Sandblast.detailed_effect:
G-Max Sandblast is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Sandaconda . Ground type moves turn into G-Max Sandblast during Gigantamax.

G-Max Sandblast deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Sand Tomb .

G-Max Smite.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Smite.detailed_effect:
G-Max Smite is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Hatterene . Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Smite during Gigantamax.

G-Max Smite deals damage and confuses all opponents.

G-Max Snooze.effect: Grimmsnarl-exclusive G-Max Move. Makes opponents drowsy.
G-Max Snooze.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Snooze.detailed_effect:
G-Max Snooze is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Grimmsnarl . Dark type moves turn into G-Max Snooze during Gigantamax.

G-Max Snooze deals damage and makes the opponents drowsy . They will fall asleep on the next turn if not switched out, like the move Yawn .

G-Max Steelsurge.effect: Copperajah-exclusive G-Max Move. Sets up Spikes on the field.
G-Max Steelsurge.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Steelsurge.detailed_effect:
G-Max Steelsurge is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Copperajah . Steel type moves turn into G-Max Steelsurge during Gigantamax.

G-Max Steelsurge deals damage and scatters spikes around the opponents which hurts Pokémon switching in, like the move Spikes .

G-Max Stonesurge.effect: Drednaw-exclusive G-Max Move. Sets up Stealth Rock.
G-Max Stonesurge.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Stonesurge.detailed_effect:
G-Max Stonesurge is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Drednaw . Water type moves turn into G-Max Stonesurge during Gigantamax.

G-Max Stonesurge deals damage and scatters sharp rocks around the opponent, like Stealth Rock .

G-Max Stun Shock.effect: Toxtricity-exclusive G-Max Move. Poisons or paralyzes opponents.
G-Max Stun Shock.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Stun Shock.detailed_effect:
G-Max Stun Shock is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Toxtricity . Electric type moves turn into G-Max Stun Shock during Gigantamax.

G-Max Stun Shock deals damage and poisons or paralyzes each opponent.

G-Max Sweetness.effect: Appletun-exclusive G-Max Move. Heals status conditions of user's team.
G-Max Sweetness.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Sweetness.detailed_effect:
G-Max Sweetness is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Appletun . Grass type moves turn into G-Max Sweetness during Gigantamax.

G-Max Sweetness deals damage and heals any status conditions of the user and its teammates.

G-Max Tartness.effect: Flapple-exclusive G-Max Move. Reduces opponents' evasiveness.
G-Max Tartness.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Tartness.detailed_effect:
G-Max Tartness is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Flapple . Grass type moves turn into G-Max Tartness during Gigantamax.

G-Max Tartness deals damage and reduces the evasiveness of all opponents.

G-Max Terror.effect: Gengar-exclusive G-Max Move. Prevents opponent from switching out.
G-Max Terror.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Terror.detailed_effect:
G-Max Terror is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Gengar . Ghost type moves turn into G-Max Terror during Gigantamax.

G-Max Terror deals damage and prevents the opponent from switching out.

G-Max Vine Lash.effect: Venusaur-exclusive G-Max Move. Damages non-Grass types for 4 turns.
G-Max Vine Lash.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Vine Lash.detailed_effect:
G-Max Vine Lash is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Venusaur . Grass type moves turn into G-Max Vine Lash during Gigantamax.

G-Max Vine Lash deals damage and causes all non-Grass type opponents to lose 1/6 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4 turns.

G-Max Volcalith.effect: Coalossal-exclusive G-Max Move. Deals damage for 4 turns.
G-Max Volcalith.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Volcalith.detailed_effect:
G-Max Volcalith is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Coalossal . Rock type moves turn into G-Max Volcalith during Gigantamax.

G-Max Volcalith deals damage for 4 turns.

G-Max Volt Crash.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Volt Crash.detailed_effect:
G-Max Volt Crash is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Pikachu . Electric type moves turn into G-Max Volt Crash during Gigantamax.

G-Max Volt Crash deals damage and paralyzes all opponents.

G-Max Wildfire.effect: Charizard-exclusive G-Max Move. Damages non-Fire types for 4 turns.
G-Max Wildfire.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Wildfire.detailed_effect:
G-Max Wildfire is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Charizard . Fire type moves turn into G-Max Wildfire during Gigantamax.

G-Max Wildfire deals damage and causes all non-Fire type opponents to lose 1/6 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4 turns.

G-Max Wind Rage.effect: Corviknight-exclusive G-Max Move. Removes battlefield hazards.
G-Max Wind Rage.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
G-Max Wind Rage.detailed_effect:
G-Max Wind Rage is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield , exclusive to Corviknight . Flying type moves turn into G-Max Wind Rage during Gigantamax.

G-Max Wind Rage removes the effects of all battlefield hazards, including Reflect , Light Screen , Spikes , and Terrain conditions.

Gastro Acid.effect: Cancels out the effect of the opponent's Ability.
Gastro Acid.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gastro Acid turns into Z-Gastro Acid and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Gastro Acid.detailed_effect: Cancels out the effect of the opponent's Ability.

Gear Grind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Grind turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.
Gear Grind.detailed_effect:
Gear Grind deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time).

Each strike of Gear Grind is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Gear Up.effect: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
Gear Up.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.
Gear Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Up turns into Z-Gear Up and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Gear Up.detailed_effect: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

Genesis Supernova.detailed_effect: Genesis Supernova is a Psychic type Z-move exclusive to Mew . It is used with the move Psychic .

Geomancy.effect: Charges on first turn, sharply raises user's Sp. Attack, Sp. Defense and Speed on the second.
Geomancy.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Geomancy turns into Z-Geomancy and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Geomancy.detailed_effect:
Geomancy charges on the first turn. On the second turn it raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by two stages each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Geomancy is the signature move of Xerneas . In battle, rainbow-colored light erupts from the ground around the user.

Giga Drain.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Giga Drain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Drain turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.
Giga Drain.detailed_effect:
Giga Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

Giga Impact.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Impact turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Giga Impact.detailed_effect:
Giga Impact deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn).

If the user has the ability Truant , it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around .

Giga Impact is the Physical counterpart to Hyper Beam .

Gigaton Hammer.effect: Cannot be used twice in a row.
Gigaton Hammer.detailed_effect: Cannot be used twice in a row.

Gigavolt Havoc.detailed_effect: Gigavolt Havoc is the Electric type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Glacial Lance.effect: The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.
Glacial Lance.detailed_effect: The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.

Glaciate.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glaciate turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Glaciate.detailed_effect:
Glaciate deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Glaive Rush.effect: Attacks from opposing Pokémon during the next turn cannot miss and will inflict double damage.
Glaive Rush.detailed_effect: Attacks from opposing Pokémon during the next turn cannot miss and will inflict double damage.

Glare.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glare turns into Z-Glare and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Glare.detailed_effect:
Glare paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6 ).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Glitzy Glow.detailed_effect:
Glitzy Glow deals damage and reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Light Screen ).

Glitzy Glow is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Sizzly Slide , Baddy Bad , Sappy Seed , Freezy Frost , and Sparkly Swirl .

Grass Knot.effect: The heavier the opponent, the stronger the attack.
Grass Knot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Knot turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.
Grass Knot.detailed_effect: Grass Knot inflicts greater damage on heavier opponents , as shown in the table.

Grass Pledge.effect: Added effects appear if preceded by Water Pledge or succeeded by Fire Pledge.
Grass Pledge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Pledge turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.
Grass Pledge.detailed_effect:
Grass Pledge deals damage at base power 80 . If a teammate uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.

The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move . When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.

If Grass Pledge is used with Fire Pledge , the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns.

If Grass Pledge is used with Water Pledge , the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.

Grass Whistle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Whistle turns into Z-Grass Whistle and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Grass Whistle.detailed_effect:
Grass Whistle puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Grassy Terrain.effect: Restores a little HP of all Pokémon for 5 turns.
Grassy Terrain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grassy Terrain turns into Z-Grassy Terrain and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Grassy Terrain.detailed_effect:
Grassy Terrain creates a low-lying grassy field lasting 5 turns, that restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn, by 1/16 of their maximum HP. The power of Grass type moves also increases by 50% while in effect, and the moves Earthquake , Magnitude , and Bulldoze halve in power.

Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Grassy Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.

The move Nature Power turns into Energy Ball under Grassy Terrain .

Grav Apple.detailed_effect: Lowers the opponent's Defense stat. (100% chance)

Gravity.effect: Prevents moves like Fly and Bounce and the Ability Levitate for 5 turns.
Gravity.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gravity turns into Z-Gravity and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Gravity.detailed_effect: Prevents moves like Fly and Bounce and the Ability Levitate for 5 turns.

Growl.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growl turns into Z-Growl and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Growl.detailed_effect:
Growl lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Growth.effect: Raises user's Attack and Special Attack.
Growth.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growth turns into Z-Growth and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Growth.detailed_effect:
Growth raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. During harsh sunlight it raises each stat by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Grudge.effect: If the users faints after using this move, the PP for the opponent's last move is depleted.
Grudge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grudge turns into Z-Grudge and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Grudge.detailed_effect: If the users faints after using this move, the PP for the opponent's last move is depleted.

Guard Split.effect: Averages Defense and Special Defense with the target.
Guard Split.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Split turns into Z-Guard Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Guard Split.detailed_effect:
Guard Split averages the user's Defense and Special Defense with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account.

For example, if the user's Defense was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Screech on the user, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Defense. Due to the stat drop, the Guard Split user's effective Defense would now be 75 (instead of the 50 it was originally).

Guard Swap.effect: User and opponent swap Defense and Special Defense.
Guard Swap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Swap turns into Z-Guard Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Guard Swap.detailed_effect: User and opponent swap Defense and Special Defense.

Guardian of Alola.effect: Tapu-exclusive Z-move. Cuts opponent's HP by 75%.
Guardian of Alola.detailed_effect:
Guardian of Alola is a Z-move exclusive to the guardian deities of Alola - Tapu Koko , Tapu Lele , Tapu Bulu and Tapu Fini . It is used with Nature's Madness .

Guardian of Alola cuts the target's HP by 75% of its remaining HP.

Guillotine.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guillotine turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.
Guillotine.detailed_effect:
If it hits, Guillotine is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.

Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Guillotine has 30% accuracy.

Gunk Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gunk Shot turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.
Gunk Shot.detailed_effect:
Gunk Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Gust.effect: Hits Pokémon using Fly/Bounce/Sky Drop with double power.
Gust.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Gust.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gust turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100.
Gust.detailed_effect: Gust deals damage and can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Fly or Sky Drop - in which case the power is doubled.

Gyro Ball.effect: The slower the user, the stronger the attack.
Gyro Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gyro Ball turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.
Gyro Ball.detailed_effect:
Gyro Ball inflicts varying damage: the slower the user compared to the opponent, the higher the damage, up to a maximum base power of 150 . The base power is calculated as:

For example, if the opponent is twice as fast as the user, Gyro Ball will have base power 50.

Hail.effect: Non-Ice types are damaged for 5 turns.
Hail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hail turns into Z-Hail and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Hail.detailed_effect: Hail creates a hailstorm that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects:

Hammer Arm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hammer Arm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.
Hammer Arm.detailed_effect:
Hammer Arm deals damage but lowers the user's Speed by one stage after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Happy Hour.effect: Doubles prize money from trainer battles.
Happy Hour.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.
Happy Hour.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Happy Hour turns into Z-Happy Hour and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Happy Hour.detailed_effect:
Happy Hour has no battle effect. Instead, it doubles the prize money awarded to the player at the end of the battle. If the Amulet Coin or Luck Incense is held by any Pokémon in battle, and any Pokémon uses Happy Hour during the battle, the prize money is quadrupled.

Happy Hour is an event-exclusive move known by Inkay from a Japanese event.

Hard Press.detailed_effect: The target is crushed with an arm, a claw, or the like to inflict damage. The more HP the target has left, the greater the move’s power.

Harden.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Harden turns into Z-Harden and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Harden.detailed_effect:
Harden raises the user's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Haze.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Haze turns into Z-Haze and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Head Charge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Charge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Head Charge.detailed_effect: Head Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1/4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.

Head Smash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Smash turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.
Head Smash.detailed_effect: Head Smash deals damage, but the user receives 1/2 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.

Headbutt.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Headbutt turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Headbutt.detailed_effect:
Headbutt deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Headlong Rush.detailed_effect:
Headlong Rush deals damage, but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense stats by one stage each after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Heal Bell.effect: Heals the user's party's status conditions.
Heal Bell.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.
Heal Bell.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Bell turns into Z-Heal Bell and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Heal Bell.detailed_effect: Heals the user's party's status conditions.

Heal Block.effect: Prevents the opponent from restoring HP for 5 turns.
Heal Block.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Block turns into Z-Heal Block and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Heal Block.detailed_effect: Prevents the opponent from restoring HP for 5 turns.

Heal Order.effect: User recovers half its max HP.
Heal Order.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Order turns into Z-Heal Order and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Heal Order.detailed_effect: Heal Order recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.

Heal Pulse.effect: Restores half the target's max HP.
Heal Pulse.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Heal Pulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Pulse turns into Z-Heal Pulse and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Heal Pulse.detailed_effect: Heal Pulse restores half of the target's maximum HP. It can be used on team-mates but not on itself.

Healing Wish.effect: The user faints and the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
Healing Wish.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Healing Wish has no additional effect.
Healing Wish.detailed_effect: The user faints and the next Pokémon released is fully healed.

Heart Stamp.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Stamp turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120.
Heart Stamp.detailed_effect:
Heart Stamp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Heart Swap.effect: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.
Heart Swap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Swap turns into Z-Heart Swap and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Heart Swap.detailed_effect: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.

Heat Crash.effect: The heavier the user, the stronger the attack.
Heat Crash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Crash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Heat Crash.detailed_effect:
Heat Crash inflicts more damage the heavier the user compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = User Weight ÷ Target Weight

For example, if the user's weight is at least 4 times more than the target but less than 5 times, Heat Crash hits with 100 base power.

If the target has used Minimize , Heat Crash ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Heat Wave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Wave turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175.
Heat Wave.detailed_effect:
Heat Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Heavy Slam.effect: The heavier the user, the stronger the attack.
Heavy Slam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heavy Slam turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.
Heavy Slam.detailed_effect:
Heavy Slam inflicts more damage the heavier the user compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = User Weight ÷ Target Weight

For example, if the user's weight is at least 4 times more than the target but less than 5 times, Heavy Slam hits with 100 base power.

If the target has used Minimize , Heavy Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Helping Hand.effect: In Double Battles, boosts the power of the partner's move.
Helping Hand.targets: Targets an adjacent Pokémon on the user’s team.
Helping Hand.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Helping Hand turns into Z-Helping Hand and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Helping Hand.detailed_effect: In Double Battles, boosts the power of the partner's move.

Hex.effect: Inflicts more damage if the target has a status condition.
Hex.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hex turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.
Hex.detailed_effect: Hex inflicts damage, but if the target has a major status ailment (i. e. is burned, poisoned, paralyzed, asleep or frozen) it will double in power to 130.

Hidden Power.effect: Type and power depends on user's IVs.
Hidden Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hidden Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Hidden Power.detailed_effect:
Hidden Power deals damage, however its type varies for every Pokémon, depending on that Pokémon's Individual Values (IVs). This makes it a useful move for coverage - giving the Pokémon a type of move they don't normally have.

Hidden Power can be any type except Normal or Fairy. It receives STAB if the user's type matches the type given to Hidden Power .

Individual Values are 6 hidden numbers (one for each stat) that are randomly generated upon encountering a Pokémon. It is not possible to find your exact IVs in-game.

You can find the type of Hidden Power in-game by talking to a particular character who will state the type a Pokémon's Hidden Power would be if it learned the move. They are located at:

It is also possible to determine via elimination by using the move against different Pokémon, or against Kecleon , whose ability Color Change will tell you the type.

High Horsepower.effect: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.
High Horsepower.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Horsepower turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.
High Horsepower.detailed_effect: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.

High Jump Kick.effect: If it misses, the user loses half their HP.
High Jump Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 195.
High Jump Kick.detailed_effect: High Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1/2 of its maximum HP. High Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

Hold Back.effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
Hold Back.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hold Back turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Hold Back.detailed_effect: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.

Hold Hands.effect: Makes the user and an ally very happy.
Hold Hands.targets: Targets an adjacent Pokémon on the user’s team.
Hold Hands.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hold Hands turns into Z-Hold Hands and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Hold Hands.detailed_effect: Makes the user and an ally very happy.

Hone Claws.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hone Claws turns into Z-Hone Claws and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Hone Claws.detailed_effect:
Hone Claws raises the user's Attack and Accuracy by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Horn Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Horn Attack.detailed_effect: Horn Attack deals damage with no additional effect.

Horn Drill.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Drill turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.
Horn Drill.detailed_effect:
If it hits, Horn Drill is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.

Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Horn Drill has 30% accuracy.

Horn Leech.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Horn Leech.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Leech turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.
Horn Leech.detailed_effect:
Horn Leech deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.

Howl.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.
Howl.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Howl turns into Z-Howl and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Howl.detailed_effect:
Howl raises the Attack of the user and its teammates by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Hurricane.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Hurricane.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hurricane turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 185.
Hurricane.detailed_effect:
Hurricane deals damage and has a 30% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

If used during rain , Hurricane ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight , its accuracy drops to 50%. Hurricane can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Fly and Bounce .

Hydro Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Cannon turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200.

Hydro Pump.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Pump turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.
Hydro Pump.detailed_effect: Hydro Pump deals damage with no additional effect.

Hydro Steam.detailed_effect: Hydro Steam deals damage, and its power is boosted by 50% in harsh sunlight, instead of being reduced.

Hydro Vortex.detailed_effect: Hydro Vortex is the Water type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Hyper Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Beam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Hyper Beam.detailed_effect:
Hyper Beam deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn).

If the user has the ability Truant , it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around .

Hyper Beam is the Special counterpart to Giga Impact .

Hyper Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Hyper Fang.detailed_effect:
Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Hyper Voice.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Hyper Voice.detailed_effect: Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes. Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof .

Hyperspace Fury.effect: Lowers user's Defense. Can strike through Protect/Detect.
Hyperspace Fury.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Fury turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 180.
Hyperspace Fury.detailed_effect:
Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect -like move.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound .

Hyperspace Hole.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Hole turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Hyperspace Hole.detailed_effect:
Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect -like move.

It is the signature move of Hoopa .

Hypnosis.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hypnosis turns into Z-Hypnosis and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Hypnosis.detailed_effect:
Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Ice Ball.effect: Doubles in power each turn for 5 turns.
Ice Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Ball turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
Ice Ball.detailed_effect:
Ice Ball deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively.

If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Ice Ball doubles in power, i. e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.

As Ice Ball has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Ice Ball is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.

Ice Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 175.
Ice Beam.detailed_effect:
Ice Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Ice Burn.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second. May burn opponent.
Ice Burn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Burn turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.
Ice Burn.detailed_effect:
The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb , Ice Burn executes in one turn.

Ice Fang.effect: May cause flinching and/or freeze opponent.
Ice Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Fang turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Ice Fang.detailed_effect:
Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Ice Hammer.effect: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however.
Ice Hammer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Hammer turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.
Ice Hammer.detailed_effect: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however. (100% chance)

Ice Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Punch turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.
Ice Punch.detailed_effect:
Ice Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Ice Shard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Shard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
